greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} phi(n/d)^d, where phi = Euler totient function (A000010).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} phi(n/gcd(k, n))^(gcd(k, n) - 1). - _Seiichi Manyama_, Mar 13 2021
mathematica: nmax = 55; CoefficientList[Series[Sum[EulerPhi[k] x^k/(1 - EulerPhi[k] x^k), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] // Rest
nmax = 55; CoefficientList[Series[-Log[Product[(1 - EulerPhi[k] x^k)^(1/k), {k, 1, nmax}]], {x, 0, nmax}], x] Range[0, nmax] // Rest
program: (PARI) a(n) = sum(k=1, n, eulerphi(n/gcd(k, n))^(gcd(k, n)-1)); \\ _Seiichi Manyama_, Mar 13 2021
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jul 25 2019
